topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces the show and Nikita Miller’s background (The Knot Worldwide, Dooly, Trello/Atlassian) and previews topics like team alignment, remote work, and PM career advice.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Wealthfront and Lenny’s Jobs/Talent collective.

topics.title: The Knot Worldwide strategy and product scope
topics.summary: They discuss The Knot Worldwide’s portfolio (including The Bump) and the strategy of supporting major life celebrations, plus adjacent opportunities like registries and baby showers.

topics.title: Who Trello is for vs other tools
topics.summary: Nikita explains Trello’s origins as a simple, broadly useful planning tool and how it evolved toward more sophisticated and software-focused use cases over time, contrasting it with tools that start complex.

topics.title: Growing Trello in enterprise and collaboration
topics.summary: Nikita shares her work building Trello’s enterprise motion: expanding from small teams to org-wide adoption, emphasizing collaboration, and adding many small enterprise-grade capabilities.

topics.title: Trello vs Jira decision guide
topics.summary: A practical heuristic: Trello works well for early ideation, discovery, and lightweight tracking; Jira is often better once work is defined and needs detailed task breakdown and execution tracking.

topics.title: Building productivity products for PMs
topics.summary: They discuss the challenges of building productivity software for diverse roles (PM, design, engineering, data) and the trade-offs of serving broad audiences versus narrowing to software development needs.

topics.title: PMs vs couples planning weddings
topics.summary: Nikita compares wedding planning to product work: high-stakes, emotional, stakeholder-heavy, long-horizon projects; she also contrasts SaaS with The Knot’s multi-business model and user needs.

topics.title: Trello power tips: Power-Ups and integrations
topics.summary: Nikita recommends underused Trello Power-Ups (integrations) as the main way to extend Trello’s capabilities for more complex workflows.

topics.title: Aligning teams with roles and responsibilities contracts
topics.summary: Nikita outlines a structured exercise where PM, design, engineering, and data leaders write expectations for themselves and each other, reconcile differences, and cascade a shared “contract” across teams.

topics.title: Execution and velocity: outcomes vs output
topics.summary: They dig into common causes of slow delivery (decision velocity, ticket sizing, unclear articulation) and the need to balance outcome-focus with shipping output as a key indicator of progress and urgency.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for Ahrefs Webmaster Tools.

topics.title: How product management is changing
topics.summary: Nikita describes PM becoming mainstream (degrees, career paths), shifting expectations (PMs more technical, designers more business-savvy, engineers more product/user-focused), and deeper cross-functional collaboration.

topics.title: Getting into PM, stress of the role, work-life optimization
topics.summary: Nikita shares entry paths into PM (big-tech programs, startups) and discusses the role’s inherent stress; she reframes work-life balance as “optimization” that changes by season and life stage.

topics.title: Remote and distributed teams: documentation and offsites
topics.summary: Nikita explains what makes remote work succeed (documentation, async communication) and why periodic in-person time is crucial for trust and solving hard problems; she describes how she structures focused 48-hour offsites.
